data.title: West Valley College
data.text:
Viking Friday

Welcome new & returning Vikings! Mark your calendars for August 16, and join us for Viking Friday! Meet fellow students, take a tour of our beautiful campus, and connect with your academic school & deans. While you are here, learn about the tools and resources we provide that ensures your success throughout the semester. Enjoy free food and have a chance to win an exciting prize. We can't wait to see you!

Free giveaways

Get questions answered

Meet the deans

Tour the campus

Oh, and while you are here, be sure to stick around for special extended hours from 2-5 p.m. for Admissions & Financial Aid support at the Student Services Center!

Learn about our Financial Aid options

Schedule a counseling appointment

Take a campus tour

Get your ID cards

Register for classes

Schedule:

10:00 Check-in Plaza outside of Student Services Center 10:00 – 11:00 Resource Fair in the SSC Quad 10:30 Coffee with the President for Parents and Guests - Fox Building 11:00 How to Support your College Student Workshop Parent/Guests – Fox Building 11:00 Viking Friday Kicks Offs - Campus Center 11:30 – 12:45 Students meet their dean and walking tour of schools/colleges 11:30 – 12:45 How to Pick a Major workshop for students undecided on their major – Fox Building 12:45 Lunch opens for students – in the Campus Center 12:45 Resource Fair reopens – in the SSC Quad 2:00 Resource Fair closes 2:00 – 5:00 Get Things Done: Student Needs for bus passes, Admissions, Financial Aid, Counseling, FYE, EOPS, TRIO, Campus Tours

Viking Friday

Location

Campus Center | CC

Viking Friday 10:00 AM, Campus Center | CC

Registration Saturday

Join us for Registration Saturday on-campus for hands-on-help from West Valley College staff to help get you registered and more!

Register for classes

Get hands-on-help and all your questions answered

Take a campus tour while enjoying our famous breakfast burritos!

Free event parking in lot 4.

Assessment Test: ESL (English as a Second Language)

New students will learn about the ESL program, complete an intake survey, and use the ESL online guided placement tool to choose their best level.

Learn more about ESL Assessment.

Tour of San Jose State University

Join the Mission and West Valley MESA Programs for a tour of San Jose State University and its STEM facilities.

Tour of San Jose State University

Location

San Jose State University

Tour of San Jose State University 12:00 AM, San Jose State University

Conference for Engineering Diversity

The mission of CED is to provide professional and personal development workshops to enhance the skills needed to enter and thrive in Silicon Valley.

Participants have space to actively engage in conversation and increase their understanding of the role each stakeholder has and how to contribute to the advancement of diversity in the workplace.

Conference for Engineering Diversity

Location

San Jose State University

Conference for Engineering Diversity 7:30 AM, San Jose State University

SACNAS Conference

The largest multidisciplinary and multicultural STEM diversity conference in the country, SACNAS' (Society for Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics & Native Americans in Science) premier conference is a gathering which serves to equip, empower, and energize participants for their academic and professional paths in STEM. Over the course of the event, college-level through professional attendees are immersed in cutting-edge STEM research, professional development sessions, motivational keynote speakers, and the Academic & Career Expo, as well as multicultural celebrations and traditions, and an inclusive and welcoming community of peers, mentors, and role models. Simply put, the NDiSTEM Conference is a broadly inclusive space where you are encouraged and empowered to bring your whole self to STEM.

SACNAS Conference

Location

Phoenix Convention Center

SACNAS Conference 12:00 AM, Phoenix Convention Center
